page.title: 12Water Supply and Drainage.
page.content: From whichever direction{Doncaster}is aproached{water towers}can be seen on the horizon.The two white towers on {Cantley Lane}are part of the{Yorkshire {Water Authority}system which maintains constant pressure and provides storage for the water which is supplied from {boreholes.}The{height and capacity}of the towers gives some idea of their importance: {Height Capacity} 3 Tower 1 44.8m 1.36 thousand M 3 Tower 2 62.5m 2.27 thousand M In contrast to this the area in the west has been reclaimed and drained to make it suitable for arable farming. There are many small drains which feed into the{Rossington drain}and{Huxter {Well drain.}These connect to the {Mother drain}and the{river Torne.
